results.idea: Momentum scaled by volatility (risk-adjusted momentum)
results.description: Combine price momentum and volatility to prefer high returns per unit risk. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using two datafields (rsk62_1_return, rsk62_beta_1_100_volatility). SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector fields). SUGGESTION3 not needed (both coverage=1.0). SUGGESTION4 followed: both fields have high user/alpha counts. Kept implementation short to satisfy KEEP_IN_MINDs. Confidence set to 0.78 because momentum/risk scaling is robust but correlated with common alphas.

results.idea: Short-term reversal filtered by industry return (mean reversion with industry filter)
results.description: Short-term reversal on returns but neutralize stocks with recent strong industry moves. Used rsk62_5_return and rsk62_industry_5_100_val68 (SUGGESTION1). No vector fields (SUGGESTION2 N/A). Coverage=1.0 so no ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Chose industry field with reasonable userCount (SUGGESTION4). Implementation compact per KEEP_IN_MINDs. Confidence 0.65 due to mean-reversion variability.

results.idea: Size (logcap) value tilt vs momentum (small-cap value-momentum hybrid)
results.description: Combine log(cap) and medium-term factor momentum to favor small caps with improving factor returns. Used rsk62_risk_logcap and rsk62_factor_1_100_val100 (SUGGESTION1). No vector/low coverage fields used (SUGGESTION2/3 N/A). Both fields have good userCounts (SUGGESTION4). Implementation short. Confidence 0.7: size+momentum complementary.

results.idea: Liquidity-adjusted momentum (adv20-scaled momentum)
results.description: Scale momentum by liquidity proxy to avoid illiquidity noise. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_logadv20_di (SUGGESTION1). logadv20 coverage=1.0 so no backfill. SUGGESTION2 N/A. High userCounts used (SUGGESTION4). Implementation concise. Confidence 0.72 because liquidity scaling reduces noise.

results.idea: Earnings-quality momentum (net income per employee momentum)
results.description: Favor stocks with improving net income per employee and price momentum. Used rsk62_risk_nipe and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). No vector. Coverage high so no backfill. NIPE has high userCount (SUGGESTION4). Kept operators minimal. Confidence 0.66: fundamental momentum slower but stable.

results.idea: Volatility breakout (momentum of volatility expansion)
results.description: Target stocks whose volatility is increasing and returns follow. Used rsk62_risk_volatility and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). No vector. Coverage adequate so no ts_backfill. Both fields high userCount. Implementation short. Confidence 0.6 because volatility signals are noisy.

results.idea: Quality-value spread (low PB and high margins)
results.description: Long low price-to-book and high gross margin (value+quality). Used rsk62_beta_1_100_pb and rsk62_risk_margin (SUGGESTION1). Both coverage=1.0 so no backfill. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Selected high userCount pb (SUGGESTION4). Implementation compact. Confidence 0.69 because value+quality historically persistent.

results.idea: Industry momentum crossover (industry return avg vs factor)
results.description: Prefer stocks in industries where 1-month industry return > 6-month industry return (industry trend). Used rsk62_industry_1_100_val29 and rsk62_industry_5_100_val29 (SUGGESTION1). No vector. Coverage=1.0. Implemented simple crossover. Confidence 0.58 because industry timing is moderate signal.

results.idea: Factor momentum via factor return series (avg recent factor returns)
results.description: Use vector factor return series averaged to capture recent factor momentum. Applied SUGGESTION2 by wrapping vector field with vec_avg: vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val1). Combined with stock returns (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0 so no backfill. Confidence 0.64: factor momentum informative.

results.idea: Idiosyncratic risk arbitrage (long low specific risk, short high specific risk)
results.description: Exploit cross-sectional differences in specific risk (ksrs). Used rsk62_1_100_ksrs and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). ksrs coverage high (0.9885) so no backfill. SUGGESTION4 satisfied. Simple divide to prefer low specific risk with positive returns. Confidence 0.62: idiosyncratic risk premium modest.

results.idea: Mean reversion in factor exposures (reversion of beta to factor)
results.description: Target stocks whose beta to a factor has deviant recent change and expect reversion. Used rsk62_beta_factor_1_100_mtl and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). Beta coverage=1.0 so no backfill. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Implementation short. Confidence 0.55: beta mean-reversion less stable.

results.idea: Momentum with earnings-per-share trend (SPE augmented momentum)
results.description: Combine price momentum with earnings-per-share momentum. Used rsk62_risk_spe and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). SPE coverage ~0.961 so no backfill; applied SUGGESTION4 (reasonable userCount). Implementation compact. Confidence 0.67 because earnings trends add durability.

results.idea: Long-term momentum minus short-term reversal (multi-horizon signal)
results.description: Long stocks with strong 12-month returns but weak 1-month returns (trend minus short-term mean-rev). Used rsk62_beta_1_100_mtl and rsk62_5_return (SUGGESTION1). Both coverage=1.0 (SUGGESTION3 N/A). SUGGESTION4 followed. Implementation short. Confidence 0.7: multi-horizon momentum effective historically.

results.idea: Price momentum scaled by book-to-price (value tilting)
results.description: Tilt momentum toward higher book-to-price (low PB). Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_1_100_pb (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0 so no backfill. Prioritized high userCount pb (SUGGESTION4). Implementation short and within operator limits. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: Growth adjusted momentum (eps growth with returns)
results.description: Combine EPS growth trend with price returns to favor growing firms with momentum. Used rsk62_risk_growth and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). Both coverage high; no backfill. SUGGESTION4 OK. Implementation concise. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Dividend-stability value (dividend yield stability vs PB)
results.description: Prefer stocks with stable dividends and attractive PB. Used rsk62_risk_dividend and rsk62_beta_1_100_pb (SUGGESTION1). dividend coverage high so no ts_backfill. Both fields have strong userCount. Implementation compact. Confidence 0.6: dividend stability is slower signal.

results.idea: Short-term momentum inside low-turnover group (reduce turnover)
results.description: Apply 5-day momentum but damp with hump operator idea via past returns series averaging. Used rsk62_5_return and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val3) (SUGGESTION1+2). No low coverage fields. Kept operators minimal. Confidence 0.59 since turnover constraints reduce signal magnitude.

results.idea: Industry dispersion timing (long industries with low cross-sectional dispersion)
results.description: Prefer industries with low internal dispersion but positive industry returns. Used rsk62_industry_1_100_val1 and rsk62_1_100_ksrs (SUGGESTION1). ksrs used as dispersion proxy; coverage high. No vector use. Implementation simple. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum rotation using factor returns (rotate into outperforming factors)
results.description: Use recent average factor return (vector) to tilt stock selection to those with exposure. Applied SUGGESTION2: vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val3) and combined with rsk62_beta_factor_1_100_logcap (SUGGESTION1). No backfill required. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by gross margin improvement
results.description: Favor stocks with improving gross margin and positive momentum. Used rsk62_risk_margin and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). Margin coverage high (SUGGESTION3 N/A). Implementation concise. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Short-term reversal in high-volatility stocks
results.description: Exploit short-term mean reversion stronger in high volatility names. Used rsk62_5_return and rsk62_risk_volatility (SUGGESTION1). No vector; coverage high. Implementation kept small. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Beta-neutral momentum (normalize by market beta)
results.description: Scale stock momentum by its market beta to reduce market sensitivity. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_1_100_mts (short-term market beta) (SUGGESTION1). Both coverage=1.0. Implementation compact. Confidence 0.7.

results.idea: Low-liquidity premium capture (inverse adv20 momentum)
results.description: Tilt to less liquid winners by weighting momentum with inverse adv20. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_logadv20_di (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high so no backfill. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.56 due to trading frictions.

results.idea: Industry mean-reversion (short industry extremes)
results.description: Short industries that have run up too fast relative to peers. Used rsk62_industry_1_100_val29 and group normalization via zscore across industries (SUGGESTION1). Implementation minimal. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Momentum combined with book-to-price reversal (contrarian value overlay)
results.description: Long stocks with improving momentum but low PB expecting re-rating. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_1_100_pb (SUGGESTION1). No vector; high coverage. Implementation kept concise. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Factor exposure momentum (rising factor betas)
results.description: Target stocks whose betas to high-performing factors are increasing. Used rsk62_beta_factor_5_100_mtl and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val2) (SUGGESTION1+2). beta and retseries coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Cross-sectional momentum with industry neutralization
results.description: Rank returns cross-sectionally then neutralize industry effect by subtracting industry mean. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_industry_1_100_val32 (SUGGESTION1). SUGGESTION4 OK. Implementation uses zscore to standardize. Confidence 0.69.

results.idea: Earnings surprise proxy via recent EPS trend vs price
results.description: Use recent changes in SPE (earnings per share) as proxy for surprises and combine with price moves. Used rsk62_risk_spe and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). No vector; coverage high. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum of factor returns (factor momentum timing)
results.description: Construct signal from recent avg factor returns (vector) to time factor exposures. Applied SUGGESTION2 using vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val2). Combined with intercept to form scalar signal. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Relative strength vs industry (stock vs industry momentum)
results.description: Rank stock return minus industry return to find stock-specific strength. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_industry_1_100_val40 (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Implementation compact. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: Momentum enhanced by net income per employee ratio (quality tilt)
results.description: Combine momentum with NIPE (quality) to favor efficient companies. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_risk_nipe (SUGGESTION1). No vector/backfill needed. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Momentum weighted by factor loading to a high-return factor
results.description: Weight stock momentum by its loading to a factor that has recently outperformed. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_factor_1_100_qe2d (debt/equity) combined with vec_avg factor series (SUGGESTION1+2). Coverage=1.0 so no backfill. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Short-term reversal in low margin names
results.description: Target mean reversion in stocks with low gross margin indicating vulnerability. Used rsk62_5_return and rsk62_risk_margin (SUGGESTION1). Margin coverage high; implementation compact. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Industry momentum leader selection (top industry contributors)
results.description: Rank industries by recent factor returns and favor stocks in top industries. Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_industry_1_100_val11) and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1+2). Coverage=1.0; high alphaCount industry fields chosen. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Beta-adjusted value (PB divided by market beta)
results.description: Prefer low PB after adjusting for market sensitivity to avoid cheap-but-risky names. Used rsk62_beta_1_100_pb and rsk62_beta_1_100_mts (SUGGESTION1). Both coverage=1.0; used high userCount pb. Implementation concise. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum times industry effect (amplify stock momentum when industry trending)
results.description: Multiply stock momentum by industry momentum so only pick stocks in trending industries. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_industry_1_100_val3 (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Earnings growth scaled mean reversion (contrarian on growth shocks)
results.description: If eps growth spikes then expect partial reversion; short spikes with poor price action. Used rsk62_growth_di and rsk62_5_return (SUGGESTION1). growth_di coverage=1.0 so no backfill. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Cross-sectional volatility timing (favor low-vol stocks with momentum)
results.description: Combine momentum with low idiosyncratic volatility (ksrs) to prefer stable winners. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_1_100_ksrs (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Factor momentum spread (long factor winners short losers)
results.description: Form a spread using vec_avg of two factor return series to time factor rotation. Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val4) and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val5) (SUGGESTION2+1). Kept single operator to rank difference. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum adjusted for industry beta (lower exposure to volatile industries)
results.description: Scale stock momentum by inverse of its industry beta to reduce industry-driven bets. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_industry_constr_1_100_mining (coverage 0.7231) (SUGGESTION1). Coverage>0.6 so no ts_backfill needed. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Value-Quality composite (PB + margin + NIPE)
results.description: Combine PB and gross margin with NIPE for a compact quality-value score. Used rsk62_beta_1_100_pb and rsk62_risk_margin (SUGGESTION1). Chose NIPE omission to keep 2 datafields; applied SUGGESTION4 by preferring high-userCount pb. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: Short-term momentum scaled by factor volatility (avoid noisy factor regimes)
results.description: Downweight stock momentum when associated factor volatility is high. Used rsk62_5_return and rsk62_beta_factor_5_100_volatility (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Implementation short. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum with dividend stability overlay (favor steady dividend payers)
results.description: Prefer momentum stocks with stable dividends (rsk62_risk_dividend). Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_risk_dividend (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high; implementation concise. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Industry momentum decile (bucket top decile industries)
results.description: Bucket industries by recent returns and overweight top decile. Used rsk62_industry_1_100_val3 and bucket(rank(...)) idea but kept simple with zscore due to operator limits (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: High-factor-loading momentum (favor stocks loading on top recent factor)
results.description: Multiply stock momentum by its loading to the top-performing factor. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_beta_factor_1_100_pb (SUGGESTION1). No backfill needed. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Cross-sectional momentum with winsorization (limit outliers)
results.description: Apply momentum and winsorize to reduce outlier influence. Used rsk62_1_return and winsorize applied (SUGGESTION1). No vector/backfill needed. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Factor residual reversal (revert stock residuals after factor moves)
results.description: Compute residual-like signal by subtracting factor return series avg from stock returns. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val1) (SUGGESTION1+2). Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Momentum with idiosyncratic strength (returns minus industry and factor)
results.description: Subtract both industry and factor influence from stock returns to capture idiosyncratic momentum. Used rsk62_1_return, rsk62_industry_1_100_val3 (SUGGESTION1) and vec_avg(...) avoided to keep 2 datafields. SUGGESTION3 N/A. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum of low-beta stocks (defensive momentum)
results.description: Favor momentum among low-market-beta names. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,63) and rsk62_beta_1_100_mts (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Factor momentum cross-over (short-term vs long-term factor returns)
results.description: Compute difference between short and long factor averages (vec_avg for both). Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val2) and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val2) (SUGGESTION2). Kept minimal operators. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Value momentum relative to industry (PB momentum overlay)
results.description: Combine stock momentum with industry PB to prefer stocks gaining vs cheap industry peers. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_industry_1_100_val82 (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum dampened by idiosyncratic kurtosis (avoid fat-tail stocks)
results.description: Use ts_kurtosis on returns to downweight high-kurtosis instruments. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and ts_kurtosis implicitly on same series (SUGGESTION1). No external datafield to keep 1 datafield. Confidence 0.54 (kurtosis noisy).

results.idea: Momentum with gross-margin mean reversion (contrarian quality overlay)
results.description: Short names where gross margin spiked but price already ran; expect reversion. Used rsk62_risk_margin and rsk62_5_return (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high; implementation short. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Industry pair-trade by relative momentum
results.description: Long top industry and short bottom industry using vec_avg industry return series. Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_industry_1_100_val3) and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_industry_1_100_val4) (SUGGESTION2). Kept minimal. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum enhanced by factor intercept (capture unexplained returns)
results.description: Multiply stock momentum by factor intercept to emphasize stock-specific alpha. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_1_100_intercept (SUGGESTION1). High userCount intercept chosen (SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Short-term mean reversion using factor series avg
results.description: Use vec_avg of recent factor return series to identify overreaction and trade reversals. Applied SUGGESTION2 with vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val5). Combined with ts_zscore of returns (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by market cap decile (avoid microcaps)
results.description: Dampen momentum for smallest caps using rsk62_risk_logcap. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_risk_logcap (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high; implementation short. Confidence 0.6 due to size effects.

results.idea: Momentum hedged by industry beta (neutralize industry moves)
results.description: Subtract industry beta scaled effect from stock momentum. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_industry_constr_1_100_electric (coverage 0.6608) (SUGGESTION1). Coverage>0.6 no backfill. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Factor volatility arbitrage (long low factor-volatility movers)
results.description: Favor stocks exposed to factors with low recent volatility but positive returns. Used rsk62_beta_factor_5_100_volatility and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val2) (SUGGESTION1+2). Coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum combined with trading volume proxy (adv20)
results.description: Scale momentum by adv20 to prefer momentum in liquid stocks. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_logadv20_di (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high so no backfill. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Cross-sectional value (PB zscore) within industry groups
results.description: Compute PB zscore and then group-neutralize by industry via group_neutralize concept (but keeping to operators limit). Used rsk62_beta_1_100_pb and rsk62_industry_1_100_val32 (SUGGESTION1). Kept simple: PB zscore minus industry PB. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Earnings momentum vs price momentum divergence
results.description: Long stocks where earnings momentum (NIPE) outpaces price momentum (catch-up). Used rsk62_risk_nipe and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Low volatility anomaly capture (long low-vol with positive momentum)
results.description: Prefer low-volatility stocks exhibiting momentum. Used rsk62_risk_volatility and rsk62_1_return (SUGGESTION1). Coverage adequate. Implementation compact. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Factor mean reversion (short recent factor run-ups)
results.description: Short factors that had unusually large short-term returns expecting mean reversion using vec_avg factor series. Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val1) (SUGGESTION2). Kept single datafield to remain compact. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Momentum with PB quality filter (avoid expensive momentum)
results.description: Multiply momentum by inverse PB to avoid overpaying. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_1_100_pb (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high; implementation short. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Industry-relative earnings momentum
results.description: Compare a company's earnings trend to its industry earnings trend using NIPE vs industry returns. Used rsk62_risk_nipe and rsk62_industry_1_100_val3 (SUGGESTION1). Kept to 2 datafields. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by intercept (capture unexplained outperformance)
results.description: Weight momentum by intercept factor to emphasize stock-specific alpha. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_5_100_intercept (SUGGESTION1). High userCount intercept. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Short-term reversal with factor-loadings control
results.description: Short recent winners conditional on high exposure to a factor that recently declined. Used rsk62_5_return and rsk62_beta_factor_5_100_mtl (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Momentum with gross-margin stability (favor steady quality winners)
results.description: Multiply momentum by gross-margin zscore to favor winners with stable margins. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_risk_margin (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Industry pair momentum using series averages
results.description: Long industries with strong recent vec_avg(retseries) and short weak ones. Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_industry_5_100_val21) and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_industry_5_100_val4) (SUGGESTION2). Two vector fields only. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum adjusted for debt/equity risk (prefer low leverage winners)
results.description: Downweight momentum for high debt/equity names using rsk62_beta_1_100_qe2d. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_1_100_qe2d (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0; high userCount. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Price-volume momentum (adv20 & returns interaction)
results.description: Amplify momentum when volume (adv20) confirms the move. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_logadv20_di (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high; implementation minimal. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum with insurance-industry tilt (industry-specific alpha capture)
results.description: Favor momentum within insurance industry using its beta field. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_1_100_insurance (coverage 0.5011) (SUGGESTION1). Coverage slightly >0.5 so ts_backfill considered but not applied; chosen to keep implementation simple. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Momentum vs factor intercept divergence
results.description: Long stocks where momentum exceeds factor intercept expectations. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_1_100_intercept (SUGGESTION1). Both high coverage and userCount. Implementation short. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Short-term reversal in high idiosyncratic-kurtosis names
results.description: Exploit reversion in names with sudden extreme returns (high kurtosis). Used ts_kurtosis(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_5_return (SUGGESTION1). Kept to one datafield (returns) for operator simplicity. Confidence 0.5 (noisy).

results.idea: Momentum combined with gross margin leadership within industry
results.description: Prefer momentum stocks that also lead their industry on gross margin. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_industry_1_100_val60 (industry return proxy) (SUGGESTION1). No vector. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Factor carry (long factors with persistent positive IR)
results.description: Use ts_ir on factor series to capture factors with persistent mean return per vol. Used ts_ir(vec_avg(...)) idea but limited to vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val3) and ts_ir applied. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum with sector-neutralization (subtract sector mean)
results.description: Take stock momentum and neutralize by sector industry return to reduce sector bets. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_industry_1_100_val32 (SUGGESTION1). Implementation short. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: Momentum trade with turnover control (hump smoothing)
results.description: Apply short momentum but smooth weights to reduce turnover using hump concept. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_5_return,5) and kept hump implicit (not an operator here to respect operator limits). Chose single datafield to stay concise. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Momentum conditioned on low factor loadings (avoid factor crowding)
results.description: Favor momentum stocks with low exposure to a crowded factor via beta to that factor. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_factor_1_100_logcap (SUGGESTION1). Coverage 1.0. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Earnings-quality reversal (long improving NIPE with recent dip in price)
results.description: Buy names where net income per employee improved but price dipped short-term (expect catch-up). Used rsk62_risk_nipe and rsk62_5_return (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high; implementation concise. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Low-beta value (low market beta and low PB)
results.description: Combine low market beta and low PB to capture defensive value. Used rsk62_beta_1_100_mts and rsk62_beta_1_100_pb (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0 for both. Implementation short. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum amplified by factor intercept (favor stock-specific moves)
results.description: Multiply stock momentum by factor intercept to emphasize idiosyncratic moves. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_5_100_intercept (SUGGESTION1). High userCount intercept chosen. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Industry momentum minus market momentum (relative industry timing)
results.description: Prefer industries outperforming the market using industry vec_avg vs market return. Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_industry_1_100_val3) and rsk62_1_return as market proxy (SUGGESTION1+2). Implementation compact. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum with margin turnaround filter
results.description: Select momentum stocks only if gross margin is improving (turnaround). Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and ts_delta(rsk62_risk_margin,252) (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Short-term reversal in illiquid small caps
results.description: Exploit overreactions in small, illiquid names using adv20 proxy. Used rsk62_5_return and rsk62_risk_logadv20 (coverage 0.906) (SUGGESTION1). coverage>0.6 so no ts_backfill. Confidence 0.52 due to trading costs.

results.idea: Momentum combined with intercept and PB (three-way compact via multiplication)
results.description: Favor momentum with high intercept and low PB to capture idiosyncratic cheap winners. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_1_100_intercept; to respect KEEP_IN_MIND2 used only two datafields (SUGGESTION1/4). Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Factor-loading divergence (stocks whose beta diverges from recent factor moves)
results.description: Trade stocks whose factor beta changed contrary to factor returns using rsk62_beta_factor_1_100_mtl and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val3) (SUGGESTION1+2). Kept operators minimal. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Momentum adjusted by sector expected returns
results.description: Enhance stock momentum only if sector expected return (beta_5_100) is positive. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_beta_5_100_banks as representative (SUGGESTION1). Some beta_5_100 fields have lower coverage but chosen >0.5; no ts_backfill applied. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Industry reversal using recent industry return series avg
results.description: Short industries with strong recent run-ups by taking negative vec_avg of industry retseries. Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_industry_5_100_val1) (SUGGESTION2). Single vector field to stay concise. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Momentum with earnings quality (SPE positive trend)
results.description: Favor momentum stocks where SPE (earnings per share) trend is positive. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and ts_zscore(rsk62_risk_spe,252) (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high; implementation compact. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Momentum scaled by industry-specific volatility
results.description: Downweight stock momentum in industries with high factor volatility. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_5_100_volatility (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum with PB cross-sectional zscore
results.description: Combine momentum with PB zscore to add value tilt. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and zscore(rsk62_beta_1_100_pb) concept but kept implementation to two fields per KEEP_IN_MIND2 (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Factor momentum hedged by intercept (remove common intercept moves)
results.description: Subtract factor intercept from factor momentum vec_avg to isolate factor-specific movement. Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val2) and rsk62_factor_5_100_intercept (SUGGESTION1+2). Kept simple subtraction. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum with net-income-per-employee cross-section (quality tilt)
results.description: Long momentum combined with high NIPE zscore to favor efficient companies. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,63) and ts_zscore(rsk62_risk_nipe,252) (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Short-term reversal filtered by factor momentum
results.description: Only take reversals if the related factor is weak recently. Used rsk62_5_return and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val10) (SUGGESTION1+2). Kept to two datafields. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Momentum with low-market exposure (avoid beta crowding)
results.description: Prefer stocks with momentum but low market beta using rsk62_beta_1_100_mts. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_beta_1_100_mts (SUGGESTION1). Coverage 1.0. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Momentum combined with factor long-term trend
results.description: Multiply stock momentum by long-term factor trend vec_avg to catch secular factor performance. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,63) and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val22) (SUGGESTION1+2). Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Value reversal (long cheapest within recent losers)
results.description: Long low PB names among recent losers expecting mean reversion. Used rsk62_beta_1_100_pb and ts_zscore(rsk62_5_return,5) (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum while avoiding high factor leverage (reduce factor risk)
results.description: Scale down momentum when factor betas are large using rsk62_beta_factor_5_100_mtl. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_beta_factor_5_100_mtl (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Industry momentum weighted by industry-specific intercept
results.description: Weight industry momentum by its intercept value to capture pure industry alpha. Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_industry_1_100_val3) and rsk62_industry_constr_5_100_intercept (SUGGESTION1+2). Both coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum with earnings per share trend filter (SPE turn)
results.description: Only select momentum names if SPE trend positive. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and ts_delta(rsk62_risk_spe,252) (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high; implementation brief. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum adjusted by industry-specific current ratio (financial health)
results.description: Downweight momentum for firms in industries with weak current ratios. Used rsk62_1_return and rsk62_curratio_di (SUGGESTION1). curratio_di coverage=1.0 and userCount high. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Factor momentum with volatility tilt (favor stable factor winners)
results.description: Select factors with strong avg returns and low volatility using vec_avg(retseries) and beta volatility. Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val3) and rsk62_beta_factor_5_100_volatility (SUGGESTION2+1). Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Short-term momentum in low-ksrs stocks (stable winners)
results.description: Favor short-term momentum but only in low specific-risk names. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_5_return,5) and rsk62_1_100_ksrs (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum with factor intercept neutralization
results.description: Subtract factor intercept from stock momentum to reduce common-mode factor noise. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_1_100_intercept (SUGGESTION1). High userCount intercept chosen. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Industry momentum amplification when factor returns positive
results.description: Amplify industry momentum when related factor avg returns are positive. Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_industry_1_100_val11) and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val2) (SUGGESTION2+1). Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum with current ratio quality filter
results.description: Select momentum winners only if current ratio improving (liquidity quality). Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and ts_delta(rsk62_curratio_di,252) (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Momentum vs factor carry (prefer stocks tied to high-IR factors)
results.description: Multiply stock momentum by factor IR (ts_ir of factor series). Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and ts_ir(vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val2),63) (SUGGESTION2+1). Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum with discovery of undervalued industry leaders (PB & industry return)
results.description: Long stocks with momentum that have lower PB than industry average. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_industry_1_100_val32 (SUGGESTION1). Kept to 2 datafields. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum moderated by factor exposure dispersion (avoid concentrated factor risk)
results.description: Divide momentum by factor beta magnitude to avoid concentrated factor exposures. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_beta_factor_1_100_margin (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Long-term momentum with earnings-quality confirmation
results.description: Require 12-month momentum and improving SPE for stronger signal. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,252) and ts_delta(rsk62_risk_spe,252) (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Momentum with inverse factor exposure to avoid crowded factors
results.description: Multiply momentum by inverse loading on a crowded factor (beta_5_100_logcap). Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_beta_5_100_logcap (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0 and high userCount. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Factor residual momentum (stock momentum orthogonal to factor avg)
results.description: Subtract vec_avg factor return from stock momentum to isolate residual momentum. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val1) (SUGGESTION1+2). Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum with margin leadership inside industry
results.description: Favor momentum stocks that also have above-industry margin (quality within industry). Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_industry_1_100_val65 (SUGGESTION1). Kept two datafields. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Short-term reversal conditioned on factor tail risk
results.description: Only take reversals if factor ts_kurtosis is high (overreaction). Used ts_zscore(rsk62_5_return,5) and ts_kurtosis(vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val5),21) concept but kept to vec_avg plus ts_kurtosis to respect 2 datafields (SUGGESTION2+1). Confidence 0.5.

results.idea: Momentum with dividend stability and size filter
results.description: Select momentum winners with stable dividends and moderate size. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_risk_dividend (SUGGESTION1). Kept size implicit to respect 2 datafields. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Industry mean reversion using industry return series avg
results.description: Short industries whose vec_avg recent returns are highest expecting reversion. Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_industry_1_100_val19) (SUGGESTION2). Single field implementation to stay concise. Confidence 0.51.

results.idea: Momentum with gross-margin overhang avoidance
results.description: Avoid momentum in stocks with falling gross margins. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and ts_delta(rsk62_risk_margin,63) (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum hedged by industry intercept
results.description: Subtract industry intercept to remove industry-level unexplained returns. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_industry_constr_5_100_intercept (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum with earnings growth risk control (use NIPE volatility)
results.description: Downweight momentum when NIPE is volatile by dividing by ts_std_dev(NIPE). Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and ts_std_dev(rsk62_risk_nipe,252) concept but kept to rsk62_risk_nipe and ts_std_dev to follow operator list (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Factor carry with intercept adjustment (long stable factor carry)
results.description: Use vec_avg factor return divided by factor intercept to prioritize stable carry. Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val2) and rsk62_factor_5_100_intercept (SUGGESTION2+1). Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum with PB momentum overlay (stocks with improving PB)
results.description: Combine price momentum with improving PB trend (expecting re-rating). Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and ts_delta(rsk62_beta_1_100_pb,63) (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum neutralized for high factor exposure industries
results.description: Subtract industry factor exposure (beta_industry_constr) from stock momentum to reduce industry-factor bets. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_beta_industry_constr_1_100_computers (coverage 0.4388) (SUGGESTION1). Coverage<0.6, applied SUGGESTION3: ts_backfill(rsk62_beta_industry_constr_1_100_computers,60). Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Momentum amplified by factor long-term trend with winsorize
results.description: Multiply stock momentum by long-term factor vec_avg but winsorize to limit outliers. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,63) and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val22) (SUGGESTION1+2). Applied winsorize to keep robust. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Cross-sectional PB reversal within industry
results.description: Long stocks that are cheap relative to their industry after recent underperformance. Used rsk62_beta_1_100_pb and rsk62_industry_1_100_val32 (SUGGESTION1). Implementation concise. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum with short-term factor avoidance (reduce crowded factor exposure)
results.description: Downweight stock momentum when the related factor has spiked short-term using vec_avg factor series. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val3) (SUGGESTION1+2). Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Quality-adjusted mean reversion (prefer reversals in low-quality names)
results.description: Short-term reversal where quality (NIPE or margin) dropped; used ts_zscore(rsk62_5_return,5) and ts_delta(rsk62_risk_nipe,63) (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high; implementation short. Confidence 0.53.

results.idea: Momentum with industry-neutral PB adjustment
results.description: Combine stock momentum with PB adjusted by industry PB to avoid sector biases. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_industry_1_100_val32 (SUGGESTION1). Kept concise. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Factor rotation using vec_avg short vs long factor series
results.description: Long factors whose short-term vec_avg > long-term vec_avg and short the opposite. Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val2) and vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_5_100_val2) (SUGGESTION2). Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum with PB and dividend filter (value+income tilt)
results.description: Favor momentum winners with low PB and stable dividends. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_risk_dividend (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high; implementation concise. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Short high-vol momentum (capture quick runs but control volatility)
results.description: Take momentum in high-vol stocks but scale by volatility to control risk. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_5_return,5) and rsk62_risk_volatility (SUGGESTION1). Coverage high. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Momentum combined with industry-specific intercept (isolate industry alpha)
results.description: Multiply stock momentum by industry intercept to emphasize industry-specific unexplained moves. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and rsk62_industry_constr_5_100_intercept (SUGGESTION1). Coverage=1.0. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum with factor IR threshold (only when factor IR high)
results.description: Multiply stock momentum only when factor IR exceeds threshold; implemented by multiplying with ts_ir(vec_avg(...)) as continuous proxy. Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and ts_ir(vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_factor_1_100_val2),63) (SUGGESTION2+1). Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum with PB momentum confirmation (PB improving)
results.description: Require positive PB trend to confirm momentum (expect repricing). Used ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) and ts_delta(rsk62_beta_1_100_pb,63) (SUGGESTION1). Coverage 1.0. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Industry relative strength using vec_avg industry series
results.description: Rank industries by vec_avg recent returns and favor stocks in top industries. Used vec_avg(rsk62_retseries_industry_1_100_val21) and ts_zscore(rsk62_1_return,21) to combine (SUGGESTION2+1). Confidence 0.59.
